children.name: books, jokes, remarks etc that are about sex and are offensive
obscene
children.definition: /əbˈsiːn/ obscenewords or pictures are about sex and are very offensive:
examples: khiêu dâm
▪ ‘Lady Chatterley’s Lover’ was banned as an obscene book.
'Người yêu của Lady Chatterley' đã bị cấm như một cuốn sách khiêu dâm.
▪ He was charged with smuggling obscene materials into the UK.
Anh ta bị buộc tội buôn lậu các vật liệu khiêu dâm vào Vương quốc Anh.
obsceneadjective
offensive, rude or shocking, usually because too obviously related to sex or showingsex
_In the raid, police found several boxes of obscene videotapes.
_He was jailed for making obscenephone calls(= ones in which unwanted sexual suggestions were made to the listener) .
_obscene language/graffiti

children.name: dirty
children.definition: /ˈdɜːʳti/  informaldirtybooks, jokes, films etc are about sex - use this especially to show that you think these are unpleasant:
examples: tục tĩu, đồi trụy
▪ They just sit around telling dirty jokes - it’s very boring.
Họ chỉ ngồi quanh nói chuyện đùa tục tĩu - nó rất nhàm chán.
▪ He used to keep a collection of dirty books hidden under his bed.
Anh ta từng giữ một bộ sưu tập sách đồi trụy dưới chân giường.
dirtyadjectiveNOT POLITE
informaldescribes something that is connected with sex, in a way that many peoplethink is offensive
_a dirtymagazine/film/joke
_You've got a really dirtymind!

children.name: indecent
children.definition: /ɪnˈdiːsənt/  clothes that areindecentshow parts of the body that are usually covered; actions or movements that areindecentare sexual, but in a way many people think is not pleasant or acceptable:
examples: không đứng đắn
▪ You can’t wear that dress to the dinner party -- it’s positively indecent!
Bạn không thể mặc trang phục đó cho bữa tiệc tối - thật không đứng đắn!
▪ Models were forced into all sorts of indecent poses for the camera.
Các người mẫu đã bị buộc phải tạo tất cả các tư thế không đứng đắn trước máy ảnh.
indecentadjectiveIMMORAL
morally offensive, especially in a sexual way
_an indecent act/photograph
_She accused him of making indecent suggestions to her.

children.name: lewd
children.definition: /luːd/  lewdremarks or behaviour show that the person saying them or doing something is thinking about sex, and they are usually offensive:
examples: ▪ ‘Say no more!’ he grinned, giving her a lewd wink.
▪ Although his jokes were a little lewd, he always made us laugh.
lewdadjectivedisapproving
(of behaviour, speech, dress, etc.) sexual in an obvious and rude way
_Ignore him - he's being lewd.
_a lewd suggestion

children.name: blue
children.definition: /bluː/  informal films, jokes etc that areblueare about sex and usually use offensive language:
examples: bậy, tục tĩu
▪ I found the kids watching a blue movie on the video last night.
Tôi thấy những đứa trẻ xem một bộ phim bậy trên truyền hình vào đêm qua
▪ Her jokes are too blue for most audiences.
Những câu chuyện cười của cô ấy quá tục tĩu đối với hầu hết các khán giả.
blueadjectiveSEXUAL
showing or mentioning sexual activity in a way that offends many people
a blue joke
a blue movie/film
His humour is a bit too blue for my tastes.

children.name: filthy
children.definition: /ˈfɪlθi/  showing or describing sexual acts in a very offensive way:
examples: bẩn thỉu, thô tục
▪ The magazine printed filthy pictures that shocked everyone.
Tạp chí in những bức tranh thô tục gây sốc cho mọi người.
filthyadjectiveOFFENSIVE
containing sexually offensive words or pictures
_filthy language
_a filthy joke
_humorousYou've got a filthy mind!

children.name: off-color
children.definition: /ɒf ˈkʌləʳ/  American jokes, stories, remarks etc that areoff-colortalk about sex in a way that is not acceptable in a particular situation:thô tục
examples: ▪ He occasionally tells an off-color joke, but his image is practically that of a saint.
Thỉnh thoảng anh ấy nói đùa thô tục nhưng hình tượng của anh ấy thực ra giống một vị thánh.
off-colouradjectiveSEXUAL
describes remarks or jokes about sex that are slightly shocking

children.name: smut
children.definition: /smʌt/ informalbooks, stories, films etc that are about sex - use this when you strongly disapprove of this:

children.name: chuyện dâm ô
examples: ▪ There’s too much violence and smut on TV these days.
Ngày nay có quá nhiều chuyện bạo lực và dâm ô trên TV.

children.name: relating to the activity of sex
sexual
examples: tình dục
▪ Dr Ruth offers advice on sexual problems.
Tiến sĩ Ruth đưa ra lời khuyên về vấn đề tình dục.
▪ It’s important to take your partner’s sexual needs into consideration.
Quan trọng là phải cân nhắc đến các nhu cầu tình dục của bạn đời
▪ He had to admit that his feelings for her were mostly sexual.
Anh phải thừa nhận rằng cảm xúc của anh dành cho cô hầu hết là tình dục.
sexually[adverb]Tình dục
▪ 70% of all males are still sexually active they still have sex at the age of seventy.
70% nam giới vẫn còn hoạt động tình dục mà vẫn có quan hệ tình dục ở tuổi bảy mươi.
sexualadjectiveSEX
relating to the activity of sex
_Most people remember their first sexual experience.
_a sexual relationship
_sexualassault/harassment
_FORMALsexualintercourse(= the act of having sex)
_sexualorientation/preference(= whether someone chooses to have sex with men, women, or both)

children.name: describe sb who talks about sex in an offensive way
crude
children.definition: /kruːd/  someone who iscrudetalks about sex in a way that is direct and offensive, and is often deliberately trying to shock people:

children.name: thô lỗ
examples: ▪ The comedian wasn’t funny at all; he was just crude and offensive.
Diễn viên hài không hề buồn cười; Anh ta chỉ thô lỗ và xúc phạm.
▪ She was worried that her husband’s crude remarks might have upset some of the guests.
Cô ấy lo lắng rằng lời nhận xét thô lỗ của chồng có thể làm buồn lòng một số khách hàng .

children.name: coarse
children.definition: /kɔːʳs/  someone who iscoarseis impolite and offensive in the way they talk about sex:

children.name: thô tục
examples: ▪ She tried to ignore his coarse jokes and crude innuendoes -- he was obviously drunk.
Cô cố gắng lờ đi những trò đùa thô tục và những lời bóng gió thô lỗ - rõ ràng anh ta đang say rượu.

children.name: vulgar
children.definition: /ˈvʌlgəʳ/  someone who is vulgar or who makesvulgarjokes and remarks talks about sex in a very direct and offensive way:

children.name: thô bỉ
examples: ▪ He ruined the evening with his vulgar talk about women and about how much he could drink.
Ông đã hủy hoại buổi tối với những lời nói thô bỉ về phụ nữ và về việc ông có thể uống bao nhiêu.

children.name: books, jokes, remarks etc that are about sex in an amusing way
risqué
children.definition: alsosaucyinformal /ˈrɪskeɪǁrɪˈskeɪ, ˈsɔːsi/  a joke, remark, song etc that isrisquéorsaucyis about sex and is slightly shocking and amusing:
examples: khiếm nhã, suồng sã
▪ Those jokes are a bit risqué -- don’t tell them in front of your grandparents.
Những câu nói đùa đó hơi khiếm nhã - đừng nói chúng trước mặt ông bà của bạn.
▪ Edgar kept us entertained with a stream of unusual and rather saucy stories.
Edgar giúp chúng tôi giải trí với một loạt những câu chuyện bất thường và có phần suồng sã.
risquéadjective
(of jokes or stories) slightly rude or shocking, especially because about sex

children.name: explicit
examples: showing or talking about sex or violence in a very detailed way
_asexuallyexplicit film

children.name: suggestive
children.definition: /səˈdʒestɪvǁsəg-/  remarks, questions etc that aresuggestivehave a slightly hidden meaning that is about sex:
examples: khêu gợi
▪ When she worked in the pub, men used to make suggestive remarks to her all the time
Khi cô làm việc trong quán rượu, đàn ông thường xuyên đưa ra cho cô những nhận xét khêu gợi..
▪ The film "Tom Jones’ is famous for its sexually suggestive eating scene.
Bộ phim "Tom Jones" nổi tiếng với cảnh ăn uống khêu gợi.
suggestiveadjectiveSEXUAL
often used to describe something that makes people think about sex
_Some of his lyrics are rather suggestive.
suggestivelyadverb

children.name: innuendo
children.definition: /ˌɪnjuˈendəʊ/  remarks that are intended to make you think about sex even though they do not directly mention sex:lời bóng gió khiêu dâm
examples: ▪ The programme consists of an hour of sexist banter and innuendo.
Chương trình bao gồm một giờ của sự giễu cợt về giới tính cùng những lời bóng gió khiêu dâm.
▪ She found his relentless sexual innuendoes irritating.
Cô thấy những lời khêu gợi tình dục không ngừng làm cô phát cáu.

children.name: rude
children.definition: /ruːd/  British jokes, stories, songs etc that arerudedeal with sex or parts of the body, especially in a slightly stupid way:
examples: thô tục
▪ I don’t want to hear any more of your rude jokes, Damien -- shut up.
Tôi không muốn nghe thêm về những trò đùa thô tục củabạn, Damien - im đi.
▪ If you are going to tell the children some of your stories make sure they aren’t too rude.
Nếu bạn muốn kể chuyện cho trẻ em, chắc chắn rằng chúng không quá thô tục.
rudeadjectiveNOT POLITE
relating to sex or going to the toilet
_He told a rudejoke/story.

children.name: naughty
children.definition: /ˈnɔːtiǁˈnɔːti, ˈnɑːti/  British spoken use this to describe magazines, pictures, songs etc that deal with sex in a rude, but not very serious, way:
examples: thô tục
▪ Dennis sat on his bed reading a naughty magazine.
Dennis ngồi trên giường đọc tạp chí thô tục.
▪ They were reading an American novel that seemed to have had all the naughty bits cut out.
Họ đang đọc một cuốn tiểu thuyết Mỹ dường như đã được cắt hết những điều thô tục.
naughtyadjectiveSEXUAL
informal humorousinvolving or suggesting sex
_The film was shown on television but they'd
cut out all the naughty scenes/UKbits.
_He always buys her naughty underwear for her birthday.
naughtilyadverb
naughtinessnoun[ U ]
